{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3720836,"name":"Chase Eid","username":"PixL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pixl/{size}/250824_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-22T02:07:05.966Z","cooked":"

Team 2183 presents Touchboard, a digital button board useful for outreach, testing, development, simulation, and much more.

Touchboard works by sending data over network tables to the robot. I’ve made adding buttons easy by simply editing the HTML and the layout can be changed with css, (grid, flex, etc) and color can be set by editing the background color and border color with css. If your not familiar with network tables, you should still be able to use this.

Screenshot 2025-07-28 1850301340×709 48.5 KB

The buttons are created in each tab with html elements, these elements are scanned through and the backend is all handled. All you have to do is make them in the html document and style them however you like. There are many different types of input that you can use, there are toggle buttons, held action buttons, one-shot buttons, number input, dropdown selectors, and axises. You can add multiple tabs as well.

Touchscreen monitors are supported, but multi touch does not work on mac

The buttons are animated to tell the user what they clicked with their peripheral vision.

Pose Plotter

image2560×1440 315 KB

Pose plotter is the optional deployless auto builder, this auto builder sends a string to the robot that gets interpolated into a command sequence. We use pathplanner pathfind for movement, but other movement systems may work well too. The string interpolater must be included in getAutonomousCommand for this to work. The commands can be set by editing commandList array in the autobuilder.js file. Then, robot side, you can set the command that will be executed from that value.

Jukebox

image1920×1080 90.2 KB

An optional chrp player ui that lets you select from chrp files on your robot. To add them, put the cover art in the coverArt folder. Then add it to the tracks array in jukebox.js. Then make sure the file name matches the chrp in the deploy folder.

Other

This has been the most useful when doing sim, I can move the robot to a position and test things using the button board without needing to set my keyboard and worry about typing.

We have tested this at Northshore Knockout and there were no connection issues, If you have some issues or feedback ill try to get to it but I am busy with ap classes so don’t expect instant fixes.

Check the github for in depth setup and customization guides.

github.com

GitHub - Tigerbots2183/Touchboard: A touchscreen button board that communicates over...

A touchscreen button board that communicates over networktables.

Thanks to mechanical advantage for the nt4.js library that sends values to the robot!

Made fixes to pose-plotter and persistent number components. Also the way that pose plotter commands are added is now in the html and not the js. You now do not need to add any thing to javascript objects. Optgroup component has been added as well. A website based doc is in the works as well!

Also here is our breakdown of pose plotter when we were planning it out:

docs.google.com

2183 Autonomous Goals

2183 Autonomous Goals Shared functionality with teleop Modularity Consistency Not dependant on initial placement Adaptable Customizable without redeploy Any starting location Conditional in case of failed command Know a new auto works without running...
